title:
Is it legal in North Carolina for a police officer to force someone to stop filming an arrest in public, so long as they\'re not interfering with the officer\'s duties?



I saw the video of the streaker in Wrightsville Beach and heard the man with the camera refuse to comply with the deputy\'s request to stop filming, saying that it was his right in a public place.



Thanks!
text:
Generally speaking, it is legal to videotape while on public property
as long as someone is not interfering with law enforcement officers.
Taping from private property is also OK, as long as the person doing
the videotaping has permission to be there. These are general legal
guidelines.
